page.title: 05DONNINGTON WOOD VILLAGE
page.content: The village is centred around the intersection of Church Road, Queens Road and The Fields.The area was a centre for the local coal mining industry.Most of the houses were built for the Duke of Sutherland,who owned most of the land. Along The Fields are some long single storey houses which originally housed mining families. On the corner of Queens Rd. and Curch Rd. is the Ravenhurst Joinery Centre.This was the local Baptist Church until a new church was built further along Queens Rd.The village still has a general store.The old school on Church Rd.still exists and is now an annexe of the new school.The Parish Church of St.Matthews is at the top of the hill.To the north of The Fields is a modern leisure centre with gymnasium, swimming pool and playing fields.
